laboratory_examinations.findings: A de novo microdeletion on chromosome 22q11.2 was found in the patient, confirming the diagnosis of DiGeorge syndrome.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Mutation screening of FZD4 and LRP5
laboratory_examinations.findings: No mutations were identified in the known FEVR genes.
Cytogenetic analysis demonstrated a deletion spanning chromosome 22q11.2 confirming the diagnosis of DiGeorge syndrome.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Immune status, serum calcium levels, cardiovascular screening

laboratory_examinations.findings: Applied to peripheral avascular retina in the better right eye.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 12 months later, visual function and fundal appearance remained stable; however, retinal detachment in the left eye progressed, with a temporal falciform retinal fold evident.
